When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can attack with the Torch, using it as a Simple Melee weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1 Fire damage.
flavor: Torch is serviceable field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the whiff of parchment that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Torpor
entries: The torpor smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
item_description: The torpor smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.

name: Totem
item_description: Inscribed in tidy hands, the totem carries power for those who can read it.
entries: Inscribed in tidy hands, the totem carries power for those who can read it.
flavor: Totem carries crisp sigils and the dryness of vellum; a quiet creak rises when traced, and a smell of oil clings to the arcane ink.

name: Tourmaline
entries: A pale green, blue, brown, or red gemstone.
item_description: A pale green, blue, brown, or red gemstone.
flavor: Tourmaline is standard stock—sealed, weighed, and marked for barter; the hint of ozone hints at its origin.

name: Travel Alchemical Kit
entries: Also at rank 3, Head Office provides you with a travel alchemical kit—an uncommon magic item containing miniaturized versions of both {@item alchemist's supplies|phb} and a {@item poisoner's kit|phb} (glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod). You gain proficiency with a {@item poisoner's kit|phb} as part of this upgrade.

You can use this magical kit as long as it is on your person, with no need to draw or stow it. If you are ever searched, finding your travel alchemical kit requires a successful {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.
item_description: Also at rank 3, Head Office provides you with a travel alchemical kit—an uncommon magic item containing miniaturized versions of both {@item alchemist's supplies|phb} and a {@item poisoner's kit|phb} (glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod). You gain proficiency with a {@item poisoner's kit|phb} as part of this upgrade.

item_description: Traveler's Clothes are resilient garments designed for travel in various environments.

name: Trinket
entries: When you make your character, you can roll once on the Trinkets table to gain a Tiny trinket, a simple item lightly touched by mystery. The DM might also use this table. It can help stock a room in a dungeon or fill a creature's pockets.

A gold coin minted in an unknown land

item_description: Forged for perilous roads, the true-ice shards (dagger) nicks and oil stains speak to many a fray.

name: True-Ice Shards (Rapier)
entries: Simple yet dependable, the true-ice shards (rapier) its weight and balance make it trustworthy in battle.

name: Truth Serum
entries: The truth serum stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
item_description: The truth serum stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.

name: Turquoise
entries: A light blue green gemstone.
item_description: A light blue green gemstone.
flavor: Turquoise is standard stock—sealed, weighed, and marked for barter; the smell of oil hints at its origin.

name: Turtle Ship
entries: A turtle ship is encased in a protective metal shell, as befits its name, and bristles with weapons. In addition to its roomy quarters, it can carry a decent- sized payload, making it popular among traders and others who need a lot of cargo space. The ship can land on the ground, and it floats on water. Sliding panels can be closed to make the hull airtight, enabling the ship to travel underwater safely, even to great depths. If the ship takes damage while on or under the water, interior hatches can be sealed to prevent the ship from flooding completely.
Standard weaponry on a turtle ship includes three forward-mounted ballistae and a rear-facing mangonel. These weapons can't be used while the ship is underwater.
item_description: A turtle ship is encased in a protective metal shell, as befits its name, and bristles with weapons. In addition to its roomy quarters, it can carry a decent- sized payload, making it popular among traders and others who need a lot of cargo space. The ship can land on the ground, and it floats on water. Sliding panels can be closed to make the hull airtight, enabling the ship to travel underwater safely, even to great depths. If the ship takes damage while on or under the water, interior hatches can be sealed to prevent the ship from flooding completely.
flavor: Turtle Ship bears plain craftsmanship—rigging tidy, timbers sound, and the dust of old vaults of tar, rope, and long voyages.

name: Two-Birds Sling
entries: A common sight among adventurers, the two-birds sling nicks and oil stains speak to many a fray.
item_description: A common sight among adventurers, the two-birds sling nicks and oil stains speak to many a fray.
flavor: Two-Birds Sling is a prized ranged weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show nicks and polish; up close there’s a whiff of parchment and a quiet creak when drawn.

name: Two-Person Tent
entries: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.
item_description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.
flavor: Two-Person Tent is well-made field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the hint of ozone that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Tyrant Ship
entries: Beholders carve tyrant ships out of stone using their disintegration rays and use these ships to wander the Astral Plane, looking for worlds to conquer and rival beholders to destroy. No two tyrant ships look alike, but they all have one or more features reminiscent of their creators, such as a bulbous shape and eyestalks.

A spherical chamber on the ship's command deck functions as a spelljamming helm that only beholders can attune to. Any beholder that occupies this chamber can attune to it. Reducing a tyrant ship to 0 hit points not only destroys it but also destroys the ship's spelljamming helm and eyestalk cannons.
A tyrant ship can't float on water, but it can safely land on the ground.
item_description: Beholders carve tyrant ships out of stone using their disintegration rays and use these ships to wander the Astral Plane, looking for worlds to conquer and rival beholders to destroy. No two tyrant ships look alike, but they all have one or more features reminiscent of their creators, such as a bulbous shape and eyestalks.
flavor: Tyrant Ship bears plain craftsmanship—rigging tidy, timbers sound, and the tang of metal of tar, rope, and long voyages.

name: Unbreakable Arrow
entries: This arrow can't be broken, except when it is within an {@spell antimagic field}.
item_description: This arrow can't be broken, except when it is within an {@spell antimagic field}.
flavor: Unbreakable Arrow is serviceable shot—shafts straight and fletching neat, heads steel keen and treated with the tang of metal of careful oils.

name: Uncommon Glamerweave
entries: Glamerweave is clothing imbued with harmless illusory magic. While wearing these clothes, you can use a bonus action to create a moving illusory pattern within the cloth. Alternatively, you can have the pattern rise from the cloth. For example, a glamerweave gown might be wreathed in harmless, illusory flames, while a glamerweave hat might have illusory butterflies fluttering around it.

When you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) or Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check while wearing the glamerweave, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the check. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
item_description: Glamerweave is clothing imbued with harmless illusory magic. While wearing these clothes, you can use a bonus action to create a moving illusory pattern within the cloth. Alternatively, you can have the pattern rise from the cloth. For example, a glamerweave gown might be wreathed in harmless, illusory flames, while a glamerweave hat might have illusory butterflies fluttering around it.
flavor: Uncommon Glamerweave looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with careful repairs and a tang of metal that speaks of use.

item_description: The vanquisher's banner rugged enough for damp caves and busy market streets.

name: Verminshroud (Awakened)

items.name: Awakened
entries: While wearing the Verminshroud in its awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to poison damage.
You can use an action to cast the {@spell insect plague} spell (save {@dc 15}) from the Verminshroud, requiring no material components. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.
When you cast the {@spell polymorph} spell using the Verminshroud, you can transform into a {@creature giant wasp}.

item_description: The verminshroud (awakened) stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
entries: The verminshroud (awakened) stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
flavor: Verminshroud (Awakened) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with nicks and polish and a dust of old vaults that speaks of use.

item_description: The verminshroud (dormant) rugged enough for damp caves and busy market streets.
flavor: Verminshroud (Dormant) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with nicks and polish and a smell of oil that speaks of use.

name: Verminshroud (Exalted)

items.name: Exalted
entries: While wearing the Verminshroud in its exalted state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Your teeth become razor-sharp natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You can make this attack as a bonus action. When you bite a creature and deal damage to it, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.
When you cast the {@spell polymorph} spell using the Verminshroud, you can transform into a {@creature giant scorpion}.

item_description: The verminshroud (exalted) rugged enough for damp caves and busy market streets.
entries: The verminshroud (exalted) rugged enough for damp caves and busy market streets.
flavor: Verminshroud (Exalted) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with careful repairs and a dust of old vaults that speaks of use.

entries: When you grasp this walking cane and use a bonus action to speak the command word, it transforms into an ordinary longsword and ceases to be magical.
item_description: When you grasp this walking cane and use a bonus action to speak the command word, it transforms into an ordinary longsword and ceases to be magical.

item_description: Voidwalker Armor is a suit of protective gear—stitched and riveted by steady hands, meant to last.
flavor: Voidwalker Armor is a prized suit of metal and leather—buckles and rivets tight, plates and links bearing well-worn grips; it carries the tang of metal of long marches.

name: Voting Kit
entries: At rank 4, your voting kit becomes a common magic item that conceals an extradimensional space. As a bonus action, you can place one tool kit that you are proficient with into the voting kit, or can remove it. No other type of object can be placed into the extradimensional space. A creature searching the voting kit finds and extracts the tool kit with a successful {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.
Additionally, you can use the voting kit to cast {@spell charm person} (save {@dc 15}). This property of the kit can't be used again until the next dawn.
item_description: At rank 4, your voting kit becomes a common magic item that conceals an extradimensional space. As a bonus action, you can place one tool kit that you are proficient with into the voting kit, or can remove it. No other type of object can be placed into the extradimensional space. A creature searching the voting kit finds and extracts the tool kit with a successful {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.
flavor: Voting Kit looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with tool-marks and a scent of old leather that speaks of use.

name: Vox Seeker
entries: This clockwork device resembles a metal crab the size of a dinner plate. Every action used to wind up the device allows it to operate for 1 minute, to a maximum of 10 minutes. While operational, the item uses the accompanying {@creature Vox Seeker|EGW} stat block. This automaton is under the DM's control. A vox seeker reduced to 0 hit points is destroyed.

flavor: Wagon bears workmanlike craftsmanship—rigging tidy, timbers sound, and the scent of old leather of tar, rope, and long voyages.

name: Wakened Dragon Vessel
entries: This vessel can be a potion bottle, drinking horn, or other container meant to hold a liquid.

As a bonus action, if the vessel is empty, you can speak the command word to fill the vessel with one of the following (your choice): ale, olive oil, mead, wine, a {@item potion of healing}, a {@item potion of greater healing}, a {@item potion of superior healing}, a {@item potion of climbing}, a {@item potion of fire breath}, or a {@item potion of flying}. Once this property is used, it can't be used until the next dawn. A potion you create in this way loses its magical properties if it isn't imbibed within 24 hours.
item_description: This vessel can be a potion bottle, drinking horn, or other container meant to hold a liquid.
flavor: Wakened Dragon Vessel looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with nicks and polish and a smell of oil that speaks of use.

name: Wargong
entries: A metal gong, traditionally made from a shield, particularly the shield of an enemy. Both goblins and dwarves make and play wargongs, their sound echoing through tunnels in the Underdark.
item_description: A metal gong, traditionally made from a shield, particularly the shield of an enemy. Both goblins and dwarves make and play wargongs, their sound echoing through tunnels in the Underdark.
flavor: Wargong is a well-made instrument—grain smooth under the fingers, fittings bright, and the lingering dust of old vaults of performance.

name: Warhammer
item_description: Reliable in a pinch, the warhammer its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.

name: Warrior's Passkey
entries: The warrior's passkey rugged enough for damp caves and busy market streets.
item_description: The warrior's passkey rugged enough for damp caves and busy market streets.

name: Warship
item_description: The warship bears the marks of long travel and rough weather.
entries: The warship bears the marks of long travel and rough weather.
flavor: Warship bears plain craftsmanship—rigging tidy, timbers sound, and the dust of old vaults of tar, rope, and long voyages.

name: Wasp Ship
entries: Wasp ships are lightweight wooden vessels capable of landing safely on the ground, but not on water. They appeal to adventurers because they're affordable and don't require a large crew. Pirates like them because they're swift. Aristocrats are fond of using them as flying yachts because the ship's cargo hold can be easily converted into posh living quarters.
The ship's raised back provides high ground for a weapon emplacement, which is typically equipped with a ballista.
item_description: Wasp ships are lightweight wooden vessels capable of landing safely on the ground, but not on water. They appeal to adventurers because they're affordable and don't require a large crew. Pirates like them because they're swift. Aristocrats are fond of using them as flying yachts because the ship's cargo hold can be easily converted into posh living quarters.
flavor: Wasp Ship bears workmanlike craftsmanship—rigging tidy, timbers sound, and the tang of metal of tar, rope, and long voyages.

name: Watchful Helm
entries: Rumor runs that the watchful helm remembers every hand that held it.
item_description: Rumor runs that the watchful helm remembers every hand that held it.
flavor: Watchful Helm (Helm) bears a masterwork aura—cool to the touch, edges crisp, and a faint susurrus of latent sorcery beneath the whiff of parchment.

name: Waterskin
entries: A Waterskin holds up to 4 pints. If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk dehydration.
item_description: A Waterskin holds up to 4 pints. If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk dehydration.
flavor: Waterskin is plain field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the scent of old leather that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Wave
entries: Forged for perilous roads, the wave its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.
item_description: Forged for perilous roads, the wave its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.
flavor: Wave is a world-old melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show well-worn grips; up close there’s a whiff of parchment and a dull thrum when drawn.

name: Wayfarer's Boots
entries: This pair of boots is made of durable cloth, with the journey rune stitched in golden thread above each heel. While you are wearing this item, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks.

entries.name: Invoking the Runes
entries: As a bonus action, you can invoke the boots' runes to cast the {@spell expeditious retreat} spell with them. Once the runes have been invoked, they can't be invoked again until the next dawn.

item_description: This pair of boots is made of durable cloth, with the journey rune stitched in golden thread above each heel. While you are wearing this item, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks.
flavor: Wayfarer's Boots (Boots) bears a well-kept aura—cool to the touch, edges crisp, and a soft chime of latent sorcery beneath the smell of oil.

name: Waythe
entries: A staple of the gear-chest, the waythe its weight and balance make it trustworthy in battle.
item_description: A staple of the gear-chest, the waythe its weight and balance make it trustworthy in battle.
flavor: Waythe is a legend-haunted melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show scuffs at the edges; up close there’s a hint of ozone and a dull thrum when drawn.

name: Weaver's Tools
additionalEntries: Weaver's tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Weaver's tools include thread, needles, and scraps of cloth. You know how to work a loom, but such equipment is too large to transport.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana, History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining cloth objects, including cloaks and robes.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: Using your knowledge of the process of creating cloth objects, you can spot clues and make deductions that others would overlook when you examine tapestries, upholstery, clothing, and other woven items.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged cloth object.

additionalEntries.name: Craft Clothing
entries: Assuming you have access to sufficient cloth and thread, you can create an outfit for a creature as part of a long rest.

additionalEntries.caption: Weaver's Tools
rows: Repurpose cloth
Mend a hole in a piece of cloth
Tailor an outfit

items.name: Ability:
entries: Dexterity

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Mend a tear in clothing ({@dc 10}), or sew a Tiny design ({@dc 10})

items.name: Craft:
entries: {@item Padded Armor|XPHB}, {@item Basket|XPHB}, {@item Bedroll|XPHB}, {@item Blanket|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Net|XPHB}, {@item Robe|XPHB}, {@item Rope|XPHB}, {@item Sack|XPHB}, {@item String|XPHB}, {@item Tent|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}

item_description: Dexterity
flavor: Weaver's Tools is a workmanlike kit—well-fitted pieces with careful repairs, hinges and clasps snug, and the honest scent of old leather of work.

name: Wheel of Wind and Water
entries: When mounted at the helm of an elemental galleon or airship, this wheel allows a creature that possesses the Mark of Storm to telepathically control the elemental bound inside the vessel.

If a wheel of wind and water is mounted on a mundane sailing ship, a creature with the Mark of Storm who is using the wheel can create an area of ideal conditions around the vessel, increasing its speed by 5 miles per hour.

name: Whisper (Awakened)

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When Whisper reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2. Additionally, when you hit with an attack using this dagger, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.
The DC to resist being {@condition frightened} from a critical hit increases to 15.

item_description: The whisper (awakened) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
entries: The whisper (awakened) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
flavor: Whisper (Awakened) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with careful repairs and a smell of oil that speaks of use.

name: Whisper (Dormant)
entries: Crafted in old guild halls, the whisper (dormant) a straightforward design that trades flourish for grit.
item_description: Crafted in old guild halls, the whisper (dormant) a straightforward design that trades flourish for grit.
flavor: Whisper (Dormant) is a mythic melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show scuffs at the edges; up close there’s a tang of metal and a faint susurrus when drawn.

name: Whisper (Exalted)

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When Whisper reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3, and the extra psychic damage it deals increases to {@dice 1d8}.
The DC to resist being {@condition frightened} from a critical hit increases to 17.

When this dagger is used to make a ranged attack, you can choose to transform into shadow and merge with the blade as part of the action used to attack, teleporting to another location. If the attack hits, you appear in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of the target. If the attack misses, you appear where the GM determines the dagger lands (typically within {@dice 1d6 × 5} feet of the target). In either case, you appear with the dagger in your hand.

item_description: The whisper (exalted) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
entries: The whisper (exalted) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
flavor: Whisper (Exalted) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with scuffs at the edges and a whiff of parchment that speaks of use.

name: Whisper Jar
entries: The whisper jar the sort of thing one misses only when it’s gone.
item_description: The whisper jar the sort of thing one misses only when it’s gone.
flavor: Whisper Jar looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with scuffs at the edges and a tang of metal that speaks of use.

name: Whistle-Stick
entries: The {@race grung|OGA} of {@book One Grung Above|OGA} are trained to use this new musical instrument. This is a hollow tube with holes cut throughout, much like a flute. You can play music with it for entertainment, but the grung also swing it about by a sturdy cord (attached) to create a sound recognizable by other grung, so they know each other's approximate location. Additionally, grung that know {@language Thieves' Cant} can use a whistle stick in this manner to communicate over distance.
item_description: The {@race grung|OGA} of {@book One Grung Above|OGA} are trained to use this new musical instrument. This is a hollow tube with holes cut throughout, much like a flute. name: White Dragon Cape
entries: You have resistance to cold damage while wearing this cape.
item_description: You have resistance to cold damage while wearing this cape.

name: White Dragon Mask

item_description: Rumor runs that the white dragon mask remembers every hand that held it.

name: White Dragon Scale Mail
entries: {#itemEntry Dragon Scale Mail|XDMG}
item_description: {#itemEntry Dragon Scale Mail|XDMG}
flavor: White Dragon Scale Mail is a masterwork suit of metal and leather—buckles and rivets tight, plates and links bearing tool-marks; it carries the dust of old vaults of long marches.

name: White Ghost Orchid Seed
entries: More rarely, the orchids produce a smaller pod holding a single white seed. Among its various magical properties, if a white seed is ground and scattered over a dead body, the body is affected by the {@spell resurrection} spell. A white ghost orchid seed has no effect if consumed.
item_description: More rarely, the orchids produce a smaller pod holding a single white seed. Among its various magical properties, if a white seed is ground and scattered over a dead body, the body is affected by the {@spell resurrection} spell. A white ghost orchid seed has no effect if consumed.
flavor: White Ghost Orchid Seed is plain field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the scent of old leather that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Whitestone
entries: The sheer amount of leftover arcane power within the whitestone of the {@book Alabaster Sierra|TDCSR|3|Alabaster Sierras} mountains is incredibly receptive to enchantment. Magic items that incorporate at least an ounce of whitestone into their construction require only one-quarter the creation time of other magic items. Some alchemists in {@book Emon|TDCSR|3|Emon, the City of Fellowship} have discovered that dissolving whitestone with specific acids can leave behind pure {@item residuum|TDCSR}, which can substitute for expensive spell components when such materials are not readily available.
item_description: The sheer amount of leftover arcane power within the whitestone of the {@book Alabaster Sierra|TDCSR|3|Alabaster Sierras} mountains is incredibly receptive to enchantment. Magic items that incorporate at least an ounce of whitestone into their construction require only one-quarter the creation time of other magic items. Some alchemists in {@book Emon|TDCSR|3|Emon, the City of Fellowship} have discovered that dissolving whitestone with specific acids can leave behind pure {@item residuum|TDCSR}, which can substitute for expensive spell components when such materials are not readily available.
flavor: Whitestone is standard stock—sealed, weighed, and marked for barter; the tang of metal hints at its origin.

name: Wildroot
entries: Introducing the juice of a wildroot into a {@condition poisoned} creature's bloodstream (for example, by rubbing it on an open wound) rids the creature of the {@condition poisoned} condition. Once used in this way, a wildroot loses this property.
item_description: Introducing the juice of a wildroot into a {@condition poisoned} creature's bloodstream (for example, by rubbing it on an open wound) rids the creature of the {@condition poisoned} condition. Once used in this way, a wildroot loses this property.
flavor: Wildroot is plain field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the whiff of parchment that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Wildspace Orrery
entries: Inside a Wildspace system, this portable arcane device automatically tracks the positions and movements of all suns, planets, moons, and comets within that system, projecting a display of all these bodies in the space above its current location. In that display, a white, pulsating pinprick of light marks the orrery's location.
item_description: Inside a Wildspace system, this portable arcane device automatically tracks the positions and movements of all suns, planets, moons, and comets within that system, projecting a display of all these bodies in the space above its current location. In that display, a white, pulsating pinprick of light marks the orrery's location.
flavor: Wildspace Orrery looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with careful repairs and a hint of ozone that speaks of use.

name: Will of the Talon (Awakened)

items.name: Awakened
entries: When the war pick reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Breath Weapon property increases to 15, and that property deals {@damage 4d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Frightful Presence property increases to 15.
While carrying the weapon, you have resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage.

item_description: The will of the talon (awakened) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
entries: The will of the talon (awakened) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
flavor: Will of the Talon (Awakened) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with well-worn grips and a hint of ozone that speaks of use.

name: Will of the Talon (Dormant)
entries: Simple yet dependable, the will of the talon (dormant) nicks and oil stains speak to many a fray.
item_description: Simple yet dependable, the will of the talon (dormant) nicks and oil stains speak to many a fray.
flavor: Will of the Talon (Dormant) is a nigh-mythic melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show careful repairs; up close there’s a dust of old vaults and a dull thrum when drawn.

entries: When the war pick reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Breath Weapon property increases to 17, and that property deals {@damage 5d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The saving throw DC for the war pick's Frightful Presence property increases to 17.

item_description: The will of the talon (exalted) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
entries: The will of the talon (exalted) smells faintly of leather and lamp oil.
flavor: Will of the Talon (Exalted) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with scuffs at the edges and a scent of old leather that speaks of use.

name: Willowshade Oil
entries: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been {@condition petrified} for less than 1 minute, causing the {@condition petrified} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.
item_description: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been {@condition petrified} for less than 1 minute, causing the {@condition petrified} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.
flavor: Willowshade Oil is serviceable field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the smell of oil that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Wind Fan
entries: While holding this fan, you can cast {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} (save {@dc 13}) from it. Each subsequent time the fan is used before the next dawn, it has a cumulative {@chance 20} chance of not working; if the fan fails to work, it tears into useless, nonmagical tatters.
item_description: While holding this fan, you can cast {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} (save {@dc 13}) from it. Each subsequent time the fan is used before the next dawn, it has a cumulative {@chance 20} chance of not working; if the fan fails to work, it tears into useless, nonmagical tatters.
flavor: Wind Fan looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with careful repairs and a tang of metal that speaks of use.

name: Windvane
entries: Reliable in a pinch, the windvane it rides easy on the hip and comes free without fuss.
item_description: Reliable in a pinch, the windvane it rides easy on the hip and comes free without fuss.
flavor: Windvane is a legend-haunted melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show tool-marks; up close there’s a hint of ozone and a quiet creak when drawn.

name: Winged Boots
entries: Rumor runs that the winged boots remembers every hand that held it.
item_description: Rumor runs that the winged boots remembers every hand that held it.
flavor: Winged Boots (Boots) bears a notable aura—cool to the touch, edges crisp, and a faint susurrus of latent sorcery beneath the smell of oil.

name: Wings of Flying
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to turn the cloak into a pair of wings on your back. The wings lasts for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. The wings give you a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet. If you are aloft when the wings disappear, you fall. When the wings disappear, you can't use them again for {@dice 1d12} hours.
item_description: While wearing this cloak, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to turn the cloak into a pair of wings on your back. The wings lasts for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. The wings give you a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet. If you are aloft when the wings disappear, you fall. When the wings disappear, you can't use them again for {@dice 1d12} hours.
flavor: Wings of Flying looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with scuffs at the edges and a tang of metal that speaks of use.

name: Wingwear
entries: The wingwear the sort of thing one misses only when it’s gone.
item_description: The wingwear the sort of thing one misses only when it’s gone.
flavor: Wingwear looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with well-worn grips and a whiff of parchment that speaks of use.

entries: The witherbloom primer stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
item_description: The witherbloom primer stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.

name: Witherbloom Trinket
entries: When you make your character, you may roll once on the Witherbloom Trinkets table, instead of on the {@item trinket|phb|Trinkets table} in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, for your starting trinket.

entries.caption: Witherbloom Trinkets
rows: A black bird-shaped mask, trimmed with glowing green thread
A set of rabbit bones
A pair of thick knee-high waders, stained with muck and moss
A slimy green tentacle, which occasionally wriggles
A notebook containing waterproof paper
A necklace of five small vials, each filled with luminescent white liquid

item_description: When you make your character, you may roll once on the Witherbloom Trinkets table, instead of on the {@item trinket|phb|Trinkets table} in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, for your starting trinket.
flavor: Witherbloom Trinket is plain field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the tang of metal that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Woodcarver's Tools
additionalEntries: Woodcarver's tools allow you to craft intricate objects from wood, such as wooden tokens or arrows.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Woodcarver's tools consist of a knife, a gouge, and a small saw.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana, History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when you examine wooden objects, such as figurines or arrows.

additionalEntries.name: Nature
entries: Your knowledge of wooden objects gives you some added insight when you examine trees.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged wooden object.

additionalEntries.name: Craft Arrows
entries: As part of a short rest, you can craft up to five arrows. As part of a long rest, you can craft up to twenty. You must have enough wood on hand to produce them.

additionalEntries.caption: Woodcarver's Tools
rows: Craft a small wooden figurine
Carve an intricate pattern in wood

items.name: Ability:
entries: Dexterity

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Carve a pattern in wood ({@dc 10})

items.name: Craft:
entries: {@item Club|XPHB}, {@item Greatclub|XPHB}, {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, Ranged weapons (except {@item Pistol|XPHB}, {@item Musket|XPHB}, and  {@item Sling|XPHB}), {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB}, {@item Arrows (20)|XPHB|Arrows}, {@item Bolts (20)|XPHB|Bolts}, {@item Druidic Focus|XPHB}, {@item Ink Pen|XPHB}, {@item Needles (50)|XPHB|Needles}

item_description: Dexterity
flavor: Woodcarver's Tools is a serviceable kit—well-fitted pieces with careful repairs, hinges and clasps snug, and the honest smell of oil of work.

name: Woodcutter's Axe
entries: Favored by sellswords and town guards, the woodcutter's axe its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.
item_description: Favored by sellswords and town guards, the woodcutter's axe its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.
flavor: Woodcutter's Axe is a prized driftwood melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show well-worn grips; up close there’s a hint of ozone and a faint susurrus when drawn.

name: Wooden Staff
item_description: Inscribed in tidy hands, the wooden staff carries power for those who can read it.
entries: Inscribed in tidy hands, the wooden staff carries power for those who can read it.
flavor: Wooden Staff carries crisp sigils and the dryness of vellum; a quiet creak rises when traced, and a tang of metal clings to the arcane ink.

name: Wraps of Dyamak (Awakened)

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the Wraps of Dyamak reach an awakened state, they gain the following properties:

items: The bonus to attack and damage rolls with your unarmed strike increases to +2.

You can cast the {@spell misty step} spell from the wraps as a bonus action, vanishing in a cloud of crimson mist. This property of the wraps can't be used again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}, or until you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike against a hostile creature.

item_description: The wraps of dyamak (awakened) stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
entries: The wraps of dyamak (awakened) stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
flavor: Wraps of Dyamak (Awakened) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with tool-marks and a smell of oil that speaks of use.

name: Wraps of Dyamak (Dormant)
entries: The wraps of dyamak (dormant) the sort of thing one misses only when it’s gone.
item_description: The wraps of dyamak (dormant) the sort of thing one misses only when it’s gone.
flavor: Wraps of Dyamak (Dormant) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with tool-marks and a tang of metal that speaks of use.

name: Wraps of Dyamak (Exalted)

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the Wraps of Dyamak reach an exalted state, they gain the following properties:

items: The bonus to attack and damage rolls with your unarmed strike increases to +3.

When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can choose to make the attack a ravenous strike. The target takes an extra {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. This property of the wraps can't be used again until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|long rest}, or until you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike against a hostile creature.

item_description: The wraps of dyamak (exalted) stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
entries: The wraps of dyamak (exalted) stows neatly among bedrolls and rations.
flavor: Wraps of Dyamak (Exalted) looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with tool-marks and a dust of old vaults that speaks of use.

items: You can affect creatures of challenge rating 10 or lower with the wreath.
The save DC of the wreath's spell increases to 15.

items: a {@item pouch|PHB|small pouch}
a quill
{@item Ink (1-ounce bottle)|PHB|ink}
{@item Parchment (one sheet)|PHB|folded parchment}
a penknife

item_description: Includes:
flavor: Writing Kit is workmanlike field kit: straps tight, stitching true, and the smell of oil that clings to road-beaten gear.

name: Wrought-Iron Tower
entries: Crafted in old guild halls, the wrought-iron tower its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.
item_description: Crafted in old guild halls, the wrought-iron tower its edge holds well with a bit of care and whetstone.
flavor: Wrought-Iron Tower is a dread-marked iron melee weapon—balanced in the hand, its surfaces show careful repairs; up close there’s a whiff of parchment and a faint susurrus when drawn.

name: Wukka Nut
entries: These fist-sized nuts grow on wukka trees, which are popular haunts for {@creature jaculi|ToA}, {@creature su-monster|ToA|su-monsters}, and {@creature zorbo|ToA|zorbos}. A wukka nut rattles when shaken, causing its shell to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. This magical light fades after 1 minute, but shaking the nut again causes the light to reappear. If the shell of the nut is cracked open, it loses its magic.
item_description: These fist-sized nuts grow on wukka trees, which are popular haunts for {@creature jaculi|ToA}, {@creature su-monster|ToA|su-monsters}, and {@creature zorbo|ToA|zorbos}. name: Wyllow's Staff of Flowers

entries.items: Wyllow's staff is peculiar in that it can't create roses, which the archdruid dislikes. If a rose is chosen, a daisy grows instead.

item_description: The wyllow's staff of flowers is smooth to the touch, a channel for practiced magic.
entries: The wyllow's staff of flowers is smooth to the touch, a channel for practiced magic.
flavor: Wyllow's Staff of Flowers looks true to its purpose—well-kept, with tool-marks and a scent of old leather that speaks of use.

name: Yarting
entries: A southern instrument from Amn and Calimshan that is a Faerûnian analog to the guitar. Numerous variations have spread across the continent.
item_description: A southern instrument from Amn and Calimshan that is a Faerûnian analog to the guitar. Numerous variations have spread across the continent.
flavor: Yarting is a well-made instrument—grain smooth under the fingers, fittings bright, and the lingering dust of old vaults of performance.

name: Yellow Sapphire
entries: A fiery yellow or yellow green gemstone.
item_description: A fiery yellow or yellow green gemstone.
flavor: Yellow Sapphire is standard stock—sealed, weighed, and marked for barter; the hint of ozone hints at its origin.

name: Yester Hill Axe
entries: Made for wandering heroes, the yester hill axe a straightforward design that trades flourish for grit.
item_description: Made for wandering heroes, the yester hill axe a straightforward design that trades flourish for grit.

name: Yklwa
entries: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.
item_description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. entries: A complex pump organ that originated with the zulkirs of Thay, who use it in the casting of their spells. It is considered to have a dramatic, but sinister, sound.
